channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mr. Conservative and the Minister
item.description: In Nicholas Buccola’s new book, conservatives’ claim to the legacy of Martin Luther King Jr. is misunderstood.

item.title: Trump says US will begin stopping Venezuelan drug traffickers by land: 'Going to start very soon'
item.description: Speaking to service members on Thanksgiving, President Trump said the U.S. will soon begin stopping Venezuelan drug traffickers "by land," noting that...

item.title: Europe Has Made Itself an Afterthought
item.description: The once-great European powers can’t even dictate the end of a war involving a European country whose fate they deem crucial to their own future.

item.title: The Ultimate Gift Guide For The Trad Wife In Your Life
item.description: Twenty-five gift ideas to make merry every homemaker you're shopping for this Christmas.

item.title: Black Friday faces its ultimate test as desperate retailers and low consumer confidence collide in a high-stakes holiday standoff
item.description: "Consumers feel on edge," says Mastercard chief economist Michelle Meyer.

item.title: 80 Years After Nuremberg Condemned Nazi Research, Doctors Are Still Committing Atrocities
item.description: Perpetuating false definitions of the earliest stages of life mirrors the dehumanization that enabled Nazi experiments on the 'subhuman.'

item.title: Trump unveils ‘reverse migration’ plan to halt ‘Third World’ immigration, revoke Biden-era entries

item.title: Homeless Advocates Have Lost the Moral High Ground
item.description: The era of Housing First will be marked in history as a humanitarian disaster. Trump’s reforms are needed.

item.title: U.S. stocks lift on the last day of November as Wall Street eagerly awaits the results of Black Friday
item.description: Wall Street is operating on an abbreviated schedule Friday after being closed for the Thanksgiving holiday.

item.title: Our Economy Is Not Stagnant
item.description: Both sides of the political aisle are misleadingly bleak about the state of the American worker.

item.title: Billionaire MacKenzie Scott once needed her college roommate’s help with a $1,000 loan: ‘That’s just what you do for friends’
item.description: Years later, Scott repaid the favor when Jeannie Tarkenton started Funding U, a lending company that offers merit-based loans to low-income students.

item.title: War Secretary Pete Hegseth spends Thanksgiving with US troops in Latin America: 'We are grateful for you'

item.title: What is Evacuation Day? The forgotten holiday that predates Thanksgiving — and once eclipsed July 4
item.description: New York's Evacuation Day once rivaled Independence Day in popularity, featuring grand parades. Explore how this historic commemoration faded away.

item.title: The Louvre will hike prices for everyone who isn’t from Europe—from $25 to $37
item.description: Last year, the Louvre welcomed 8.7 millions visitors. 77% of them were foreigners.

item.title: A Survivor’s Guide to Wicked: For Good
item.description: This sequel doesn’t improve on what was irredeemable, but at least it’s shorter.

item.title: These Do-Ahead Meals Are The Easiest Three-Course Dinner Parties You’ll Ever Host
item.description: These make-ahead, hard-to-mess-up combinations involve just enough effort to turn a weeknight gathering into a memorable meal.

item.title: Trump says he wants to ‘permanently pause migration’ from poor countries: ‘Only reverse migration can fully cure this situation’
item.description: Donald Trump spent part of his Thanksgiving holiday railing against immigrants on social media.

item.title: On Target: The Perfect Guide To Gifting Your Favorite Firearm-Loving Friends And Family
item.description: Get the most bang for your buck with these nine gun-themed gift suggestions.

item.title: One of the two National Guard troops shot in D.C. attack dies
item.description: One of the National Guard members ambushed by a gunman just four blocks from the White House has died of her injuries, President Trump said Thursday.
